work.summary: Google Fiber builds its own routers and set top boxes.  My team was responsible for WiFi functionality and performance.
highlights: Implemented bandsteering, discouraging 5 GHz-capabable devices not to use 2.4 GHz.  Decreased WiFi-related customer support call minutes by 15% and improved throughput by up to 50% (depending on client device type).
Enabled set top boxes to use WiFi rather than ethernet/coax for backhaul, enabling user self-install and saving hundreds of dollars per customer.
Built secure public guest networks using a cloud-based TOS captive portal.  This was crucial to our competitiveness in signing contracts with apartment buildings.
Executed platform bringup for Quantenna QSR1000 wifi chipset.
Managed Fiber's relationship with a team of contractors working on mesh topology optimization.
Tech lead for a team focused on optimizing internal crowdsourcing for changes to local data.
Designed and led implementation of an API for all user annotations on Maps (stars, reviews, etc.).

Designed and implemented a Bayesian smoothing algorithm for place ratings, lowering the minimum review threshold for showing aggregate scores from 10 reviews to 5 while also satisfying new product requirements.
Improved quality scoring of reviews enough to replacing chronological sorting.
Improved local review spam filtering, and improved spam infrastructure for many types of user content across Google.

work.summary: Track.com is a subscription-based independent financial research platform.  It was sold to FX Concepts at the end of 2012.
highlights: Developed and iterated on core business concept.
Managed team of contractors to build initial software platform.
Led team of contractors and interns in general platform development.
Wrote proprietary Flash-free cross-platform (IE6-compatible) charting library: https://rofrankel.github.io/sai/docs/
Wrote proprietary conference calling system integrated tightly with our web platform.

work.summary: The Advanced Control and Evolvable Systems group is focused on biologically-inspired design and optimization techniques.
highlights: Integrated generic algorithm with physical simulation software, for design of emitter for minimized Scanning Electron Microscope.

work.summary: I was an intern on the team building the initial web-based implementation of Office.
highlights: Developed reading view for Microsoft Word web app (now Office 365).

work.summary: The Verification team is responsible for validating the correctness of new chip designs.
highlights: Implemented verification testing for Bulldozer processor core.

publications.name: Assisted Highway Lane Changing with RASCL
publications.publisher: Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence
publications.summary: Guidance system for human drivers of sensor-equipped cars.  LED- and sound-based alerts before dangerous lane changes, and speed change recommendations for safer lane changes given positions and velocities of nearby cars.
